Assistance Of Counsel.definition: the help of a lawyer which a defendant in a criminal prosecution is guaranteed by the Sixth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution see also ineffective assistance of counsel Powell v. Alabama in the Important Cases section NOTE

1.1: the help of a lawyer which a defendant in a criminal prosecution is guaranteed by the Sixth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution see also
1.note: The Supreme Court held inPowell v. Alabamathat the Sixth Amendment requires the state to provide a lawyer to a defendant too poor to hire one.
